summary: This bill, the Justice for Victims of Illegal Alien Murders Act, amends Title 18 of the United States Code to assert federal jurisdiction over murders committed by undocumented or deportable aliens. It specifies that aliens inadmissible under certain sections of the Immigration and Nationality Act, or deportable under others, who are found guilty of first-degree murder face the death penalty or life imprisonment. Second-degree murder convictions would result in imprisonment.
